did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.langmaterial: Material is in English and Spanish
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: Anthony Weir is a marketing communications executive with the Whitford Corporation and runs Weir Marketing Communications. He started his career as a copywriter for Batten, Barton, Durstine, and Osborn (BBDO), then worked as a specialist in starting up and managing offices in Asia and Latin America for the Ogilvy & Mather and Leo Burnett advertising agencies.

The Anthony Weir Papers span the years 1954 through 2006 and include advertising copy, brochures, clippings, memoranda, correspondence, photographs, and slides representing Weir's advertising career, especially his work for BBDO and Ogilvy & Mather (O&M). Clients mentioned in the collection include the Lever Brothers, Hertz, Sears, Owens-Corning, American Express, and Schweppes. The collection also contains correspondence and clippings about Anthony's father, Walter Weir, also a marketing executive; and documents from the files of Jane Maas, Weir's colleague at Ogilvy.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Anthony Weir Papers were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2003.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The Anthony Weir Papers span the years 1954 through 2006 and include advertising copy, brochures, clippings, memoranda, correspondence, photographs, and slides representing Weir's advertising career, especially his work for Batten, Barton, Durstine & Osborn (BBDO) and Ogilvy & Mather. Clients mentioned in the collection include the Lever Brothers, Hertz, Sears, Owens-Corning, American Express, and Schweppes. The collection also contains correspondence and clippings about Anthony's father, Walter Weir, also a marketing executive; and documents from the files of Jane Maas, Weir's colleague at Ogilvy.

The collection is organized into six series: Personal, Client Files, Jane Maas, Other Professional Materials, Writings, Slides, and Oversize Materials. The Personal Series contains biographical data about Weir and his family and friends through correspondence, clippings, greeting cards, photographs, and identification documents. The Client Files Series documents Weir's advertising accounts at Ogilvy & Mather. The Jane Maas Series consists of papers from the files of Weir's colleague at Ogilvy & Mather. The Other Professional Materials Series represents advertising work not directly related to Weir's tenure at Ogilvy & Mather. The Writings Series includes Weir's published and unpublished creative and professional writings. The Slides Series consists of slide images related to the advertising campaigns that Weir worked on for his clients. Large-format print materials have been removed from their original series locations and relocated to Oversize Materials. Relocated items have been indicated in the Detailed Description of the Collection by notes enclosed in brackets.

controlaccess.head: Subject Headings
controlaccess.p: These are searchable subject entries for this collection. Performing a search on these subjects in the Duke University Libraries online catalog will bring up other related research materials.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Materials related to those contained in this collection may be found in other Hartman Center collections, including the Walter Weir Papers, 1909-1996, bulk 1950-1990; the J. Walter Thompson Company. New York Office. Records, 1978-2000 and undated; the Arthur Einstein Papers, circa 1990-2001; the J. Walter Thompson Company. Thomas Sutton Papers, 1965-1975 and undated; the J. Walter Thompson Company. Corporation Vertical Files, circa 1915-1999, bulk 1960s-1990s; and the Wells, Rich, Greene, Inc. Records.

scopecontent.p: Contains clippings, correspondence, family photographs, identification cards, greeting cards, and other personal documents. Arranged alphabetically.

Jane Maas Files Series, 1967-1973 and undated

scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence, clippings, brochures, memoranda, and advertising copy from the files of Weir's colleague at Ogilvy & Mather, Jane Maas. Maas is best known for her work at the Wells, Rich, Greene agency, where she directed the I Love New York advertising campaign that helped revitalize New York City's tourism economy. Maas left Ogilvy & Mather to work for Wells, Rich, Greene in 1976. Arranged alphabetically.
